Reviews.Title: “We could see the Eifel Tower from the balcony”
Reviews.Author: travellinglawyer2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just one night on a short weekend stay in Paris and had a very good time. The location is the biggest selling point, just back from the designer shops of the rue Saint Honore and 5 minutes walk from the Madeline square and Concorde. We were very well looked after by the hotel staff, who were all very friendly and accommodating, with the receptionist happy to recommend restaurants and directions. The rooms themselves were nicely finished and from the top floor we had a balcony with a view out across to the Eifel Tower which was amazing, especially at night. The whole place also felt clean and well looked after. Another big plus was the breakfast delivered to the room on Sunday morning with a wide selection of pastries, coffee and juice. Some negatives to note about the rooms - a little on the small side (although given the location this is probably to be expected) and the bathroom could be improved (the glass door doesn't offer much privacy (and is potentially lethal in the middle of the night if you forget it's closed) despite the curtain which can be drawn across and water runs across the floor when in the shower). These points were slightly disappointing but by no means major points. Would certainly recommend a stay here if visiting Paris and we would happily stay again. Also, well worth booking through Small Luxury Hotels of the world!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Merkaba07
Reviews.Content: I booked and found this hotel through slh. It's was a true gem. I took my girlfriend to Paris to propose and we chose to stay in this hotel. The view was breathtaking windows opening up onto the Paris rooftops and a view of the Eiffel tower could not get more romantic. Staff was super friendly and helped me out with tickets and plans. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. Jl

Reviews.Title: “Book again in a second!”
Reviews.Author: GinoSF
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights, it was our first time in Paris and we could not have been more satisfied. The location was ideal for walking as we were just a few blocks off the Champs Élysées and was suprisingly quiet at night. We had a wonderful room, perfectly appointed with chrome fixtures, heated towel rack, plasma TV, free wifi, and the bonus was a private balcony where we enjoyed a very nice view. They even provided a bassinet complete with a duvet for our 2 year old. The staff were extremely helpful, spoke English very well, and kindly provided directions and day trip ideas. We will be back and we will stay here again! Thanks, GINO

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: emily c
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Excellent location and safe neighbourhood. I will definetely visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: nettie1
Reviews.Content: The Pavillon des Lettres - nestled in the ministerial district of Paris - is an attractive, design-led boutique-style hotel that is ideal for a short trip to the City of Lights. The room was comfortable, if a little small, while the bathroom was very spacious and well-appointed. Located within easy walking distance of the Champs d'Elysee, the hotel is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city to be quiet and restful after a busy day's sightseeing. Breakfast is delicious if somewhat pricey. The reception staff are friendly and helpful and the lounge area is welcoming with its fire.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and so...charming!”
Reviews.Author: htoussaint
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the architecture is just amazing and the staff so kind! The location is perfect, so close to anything else. The room is very smart and the breakfast excellent. After severals times in Paris, I've definitely find the place to stay to visit or just for business. A nice refuge to recommend absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, good location”
Reviews.Author: paranoa
Reviews.Content: As a member of the SLH club I was fortunate to have had an upgrade to a junior suite - top floor of the hotel under the roof The decor of the bedroom was great and the bathroom big but not so functional. The shower floods the bathroom, the toilet is situated under a sloping roof so no easy task when you are tall. The service in the hotel let my stay down. The checkin staff were not great and they did not propose an iPad when I checked in as is supposed to be the case. The housekeeping was not good - Turn down service was forgotten on the last night, cutlery from breakfast that I had in my room on the first morning was never removed etc. these are all several points that make what could be a very good hotel only quite average. On one night in the early hours of the morning the fire alarm went off. When I arrived in the lobby the duty manager was in a flutter and had no idea how to cope with the situation - it turned out that a client had been smoking in her bedroom. There were no apologies either at the time or during the remainder of my stay and I find this sad. It is a small hotel and it is not difficult to apologise to the clients but evidently this is not something the hotel management cares about. The receptionist at checkout was the only decent member of staff that I came across. She apologised but unfortunately thos was too little too late On a positive note the hotel is well placed and has a good cosy atmosphere to it. It is a shame the staff miss that point. I would therefore not recommend this hotel until the service is improved.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: odeeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the weekend before heading into a Disney hotel for rest of break (late-ish arrival so not worth paying the extra for tickets for 2 hours in the park). Quick efficient and friendly check in, good location near train station and also shopping centre straight opposite. Rooms were big enough for 4 (2 queen sized beds), air con room controllable, wifi a little flaky, loads of power points for charging etc. Shuttle bus frequent and at start of run so always empty. Breakfast fine. Well worth checking out if you don't want to stay in Disney hotels - ignore the review by NordNord as its obviously a totally different hotel with a similar name in a totally different location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, excellent Location, very helpful and friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: wj_cox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pavillon des Lettres in mid Spetember 2011 and had reserved 2 rooms. We had booked the hotel through Small Luxury Hotels of the World. The checkin went fine, quick and efficient, as they were expecting us and the staff was very pleasant and helpful too. We had booked a Superior room and were upgraded to a Deluxe. A very pleasnat surprise after a long flight! We ended up having a room on the first and second floors. As other reviewers mentioned the rooms were a bit small but very manageable, however very nicely and elegantly furnished. The size didn't bother us as we weren't expecting to spend all of our time in our room anyways. One doesn't visit Paris to sit in your hotel room! If you are only one person in the room, the size should not be an issue. Even with 2 people in the room with LARGE size suitcases there was no issue. Both rooms were on the corner facing the street, so you got a good view of the outside. There are some restaurants and pubs out on the street, however the rooms seem to be well insulated from the noise outside and that was not a problem. The only problem that we encountered was with the room on the first floor. The sink in the bathroom would seem to back up in the middle of the night and one night overflowed onto the floor. We mentioned this to the staff in the morning and they were very responsive to this problem and got a plumber to look into the problem immediately that day. This happened 2 nights in a row and each time the staff responded by getting someone in to look at it during the day while we were out. The problem was resolved after the second time. If it were not for this issue, I would gladly rate this hotel with 5 stars! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants and places to go and how to get there. The breakfast in the morning consisted of cheeses, meats, danish, pastries and croissants, fruits, yogurt, coffee or tea, juices, and cereals. In our opinion this wasplenty and was filling for a breakfast, although we usually don't eat a big breakfast. The WiFi connection worked fine from either room or the lobby. We had our own iPads and did not use the iPads offered by the hotel. As far as the location, it was excellent. The Palais Elysee is located a block away. The Palais Elysee is the home to the President of France and thus the security in the area around the Palais is great. The neighborhood is very safe. You are close to the Rue Faubourg high end shopping district a few blocks away. About 3 blocks away is the Champs Elysee and great strolling. The Seine is another couple blocks from the Champs Elysee, maybe 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Metro stops are also within walking distance. Finally, we would definitely stay here again. With respect to the issue with the sink, we understand that minor problems happen from time-to-time and the staff was great in addressing it. We are already talking about returning to Paris and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: xolidot
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and big - hotel could do with some updating but the staff are exceptionally helpful especially frederique and diana - pity i cant say the same about the breakfast lounge staff they were always sour and unhelpful; hotel has free shuttle to disney which takes only 5 mins. For shopping la valee outlet mall is right in front of the hotel. unlike others rating the hotel i found the beds to be quite comfortable (but then i do prefer a hard mattress) and the bedding was a reasonable threadcount for a 3star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay for our last night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelersofOZ
Reviews.Content: We adhered to other reviewers comments about the small rooms and booked a more expensive one. Our room was still small but the real problem was it didn't funtion. The bathroom was split either side of the bed, toilet had a glass sliding door (which didn't shut properly) with a curtain on it and another sliding glass door on the other side of the bed where the bather/shower was. We experienced the same situation as the last review with a booking with Small luxury hotel and a guarnateed 4.00pm check out. We ended up requesting at 1.00pm check out, but had to ask three times and eventually they said yes. The positive plus for the hotel; we found most of the staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “1st time was impressed, 2nd time was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PYIU
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 times, booked via Small Luxury Hotel as a Club member. [Mar 2011, 6 nights] The 1st time was excellent except the housekeeping entered to the room even the Stop signage was hanging outside the door. The day & night shifts staffs were helpful. The Superior Room I stayed was clean. [Sep 2011, 3 nights] The 2nd time was poor, the check-in was terrible. As a Club member of SLH, I was entitled to have room upgrade subject to availability, so I asked the night shift staff if I could have any room upgrade for this stay, the staff answered "I don't know what you talk about!", then I explained a bit more about the Club's benefits to him, he kept on answering "What do you what?! I don't know what you want", after further explained to him, he then replied they were fully booked and no upgrade was available, which was fine, it was not a guarantee upgrade, but I wondered how could he didn't know what were the Club's benefits. As per my 1st stay, I knew there were no toothbrush, toothpaste and sleepers provided in the room, so I asked for these during the check-in. As I knew this small hotel only had one staff to manage the whole hotel at night, so I didn't want to waste time on waiting for things as the check-in was at 11pm already. The same staff asked me to go upstairs to check if they were available, if no, then called him and he would bring them. Then, I explained it was my 2nd stay, I knew these were not provided and I didn't want to waste time as it was late, he replied he was not housekeeping, he didn't know what would be provided in the room and he didn't know where were they were stored in the hotel, then he questioned me why did I need two sets of things if they were provided in the room. Then, he started to look for those things until I promised I would give him back the things if they were already provided in the room. The staff really didn't know where to get the stuffs, he then took a dental set out from his personal bag. After the 30mins check-in and arguing, I went up to the room, same as last time, what I requested were not provided in the room, so I spent another hour to wait for the only staff to bring me the sleepers, breakfast form and wifi logins & passwords. I could not login the hotel wifi until I got the 4th set of logins. Regarding the breakfast form, he could not find it, so I wrote him what I wanted for the in-room breakfast. The staff kept on telling me he worked at different and many hotels, he said if you wanted to complain, he would tell his version, I could tell my version, it would not hurt his reputation or losing a job. I paid for 300 euro a night, but I felt like I was staying at 130 euro hotel. Since I didn't what my mood to be ruined for the rest of my stay, I chose not to complain about the check-in. As per my booking confirmation and as a Beloved member of SLH, the rate offers listed I entitled to have late check-out at 4pm, it didn't mention subject to availability, so I told a day shift staff that I would like to check out at 4pm, then the staff replied as the hotel was fully booked, what they could do was to give me a late check-out at 2pm, he asked me to call SLH to check about this. So, I talked to the supervisor of the hotel, at first I told him I had a terrible check-in, I was surprised that he answered he heard about it before and agreed it was a complete disaster. (If he knew about it before, I would expect someone would apologize on the next day after the check-in, but they chose to ignore it instead) Then, I asked if the supervisor could arrange me a late check-out at 4pm by showing him my confirmation which didn't mention "subject to availability", he showed the information from SLH that did mention "subject to availability", so concerning the miscommunication given by SLH and the poor check-in experience I had, the supervisor accommodated my late check-out at 4pm at the end. Thanks, Supervisor. Apart from the services, the Deluxe Room was clean, but there was bad smell coming out from the drainpipe of the shower. It was caused by the design of the shower as there was not such smell when I stay at the Superior Room with bathtub. After my 2nd stay, I would not trust the SLH Club benefits anymore as hotels would not follow. New hotels joined SLH to draw traffic, once they have their own database, they just don't care about SLH.

Reviews.Title: “Location, quality and value!”
Reviews.Author: Happyseekers44
Reviews.Content: Located yards from the presidents residence the hotel is peaceful yet a short stroll from all the attractions. This boutique hotel, booked through SLH, offers the personal touch usually missing from your standard high star hotel. Understanding service with a smile added the final polish. The rooms are small as you always find in the Parisian blocks, but beautifully presented. A luxury stay at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Disney & Shopping”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 min away from the station and has disney shuttles every half hour. Walking distance to the shopping mall and la vallee shopping outlet. Definitely recommended. Reception very helpful and rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel - perfect in a small package”
Reviews.Author: ADouble
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Thursday evening - experienced an efficient checkin service. Rooms though small are well equipped (I do wish they had a coffee/espresso machine - maybe nespresso), modern & clean. Even the bathroom is laid out with ergonomic precision. Breakfast is typical for Paris - pastries coffee fruit cold cuts etc. Does the job. Free iPad usage a nice touch. Returning in July for a 4 night stay and certainly looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ingulia
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice stylish rooms. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JWT2
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend whilst visiting Roland Garros for the French Open and the hotel was perfect for us. Super location, staff who were extremely pleasant and helpfull and a great pub across the street to have a nightcap in! Rooms, though a little small were actually fine once you settled in. Very clean and modern - strongly recommended by us! We hope to be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Polite, exceptional service, breakfast needs work.”
Reviews.Author: clarekane28
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, quirky hotel set in a quiet street right within easy walking distance of the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. The service was exceptional, and the staff went out of their way to cater to our needs and help us enjoy Paris to the full. Each room is based on a particular author. We stayed in a 'Junior Suite' and whilst the promised view of the Eiffel Tower did not materialise, the room was bright, airy and comfortable, with the modern conveniences of telephone, free Wi-Fi, an iPod dock, and as many iPads as you could wish for (requested at reception). The en-suite was well equipped with huge jacuzzi bath, shower, double sink and loo. However, you'd better get on well with your room-partner, because whilst there is a curtain, the wall is made of glass! The location was perfect, within easy walking distance of the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es, Place de la Concorde and l'Arc de Triomphe, and a metro station just around the corner for further afield. The Palais de l'Ã‰lysÃ©e was just next door, so security was high with Police everywhere. However, they were polite in their ushering of us away from certain streets and pavements. The hotel itself did not have any particular amenities (e.g. swimming pool etc) but there was so much on the doorstep that this was not required. The rooms were equipped with a mini-bar, and the hotel staff were quick to provide an iron and ironing board. There was an honesty bar and lounge/dining room for breakfast, afternoon tea and dinner, although there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Our only problem with the hotel was the quality of the food. I wonder if they were aiming for haute cuisine with their breakfast, but the pastries offered were expensive, very small and not particularly fresh. We chose not to eat there for other meals, but there was a great bistro just down the road (Cave Beauvau). All in all we had an excellent stay, and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but So Paris!”
Reviews.Author: popup420
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3 & 4th April 2011. A very nice modern hotel, rooms ( Junior Suite) very good and all facilities high quality throughout. Staff really care and keen to provide excellent service. Breakfast was a good continental type. The supply of a loaded iPad was very useful too. Location great and highly recommend boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Shame the rooms are so small”
Reviews.Author: havecrocswilltravel
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room. However when we were shown it on arrival we asked for a larger room. Not only could you not swing a cat, 2 people could not be in the room or bathroom together, unless sleeping! Fine for one night, but we had 3 nights booked. So we were shown the next grade of room up, which was still small, but at least big enough for 2 people - just - to pass and get to the bathroom or wardrobe.The other down side was the communal area downstairs. Fine for breakfast with an half empty hotel, but not large enough if the hotel were full, nor did it have any character. We had previously stayed at its sister hotel, in the Marais district. We would go back there rather than this hotel again, unless we had the larger room and they had improved the downstairs area - which apparently they intend to do. On the plus side, the bed was fantastic, really firm, with good quality bedlinen, excellent modern bathroom where everything worked (but why no plug near a mirror for drying your hair? ), really good service and an excellent location. A quirky extra is that you are offered for free an ipad for the duration of your stay. Great if yu are French, but frustrating if not, as it keeps changing your words into French whilst typing...... I would only recommend this hotel if you don't mind seriously small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Parisien Quarters”
Reviews.Author: Mick_Rollingstone
Reviews.Content: Hotel de l'Elysee is a lovely hotel, within walking distance of all of Paris, and about 10 mins walk from Champs Elysee/Clemenceau and Miromesnil Metro Stations. A Sunday stroll along Rue Fauberg St Honore past the shops full of things you can't afford and don't want anyway takes you to Madeleine, while close by, Bugsy's and the little Cafe bar just down the street are recommended. The French Interior Ministry is across the street, so loads of security makes the area pretty safe at night for those of a nervous disposition. Short walk to River - Tower / Champs Elysees / Tuileries - Louvre / Opera. Clean, nice staff, good breakfast, Our new Paris Apartment! Be careful on the stairs though, very french design...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bit tired fixtures and fittings”
Reviews.Author: RogueRogan
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel, it has a great location near a lot of the French ministry buildings with many police located around the area. Not too much of a walk to the Champs ElysÃ©e and other top end shopping locations around Madeline. All rooms are air conditioned with TV and en-suite, ours was clean with good quality soap etc supplied. My partner has an allergy to feathers and they were helpful in supplying a synthetic pillow. The hotel does allow pets, however our room was vacuum clean so wasn't too much of an issue with my partners allergies. There is a good bar over the road - Bugsy's Speakeasy, run by English staff and a mostly English speaking client base, handy to get information about Paris etc from and a night cap. However the exchange rate at the moment is making a beer quite expensive - even for Paris standards! Breakfast was very simple, juice, bread, pain au chocolat and croissant, some jam and a coffee - but all perfectly okay. The rooms etc were 'rustic' quite in need of refurbishment but nothing that is all out of the ordinary for Paris. Our room was a decent size, not large but perfectly okay.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Parisian Classic”
Reviews.Author: GitaneLondon
Reviews.Content: For a short break stay in Paris, at the budget end of the market, this takes some beating. This hotel has the quaint/stylish feel of a French Paris that is fast erroding under the waves of slick/bland globalisation. It has giant mirrors and drapes everywhere; helpful, friendly staff; a lift that just about holds two people with their cases stood on end; chintzy sofas and a love seat (for 3 people!) in the lounge; excellent croissants, jams, coffee and freshly squeezed juices for our inclusive breakfast.. Our room was not huge but adequate and clean, with seperate toilet and bathrooms, large built-in wardrobe and french windows looking onto the street 3 floors below. The immediate vicinity has a bar and cafe just across the street and high fashion (and prices!) just around the corner. The area swarms with security due to the Palais de l'Elysee down the road - a feelgood when returning late/early hours. I understand that the hotel is due to be closed for 'refurbishment' during winter '08 - '09. I only hope they don't "modernise" this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in safe location”
Reviews.Author: Emmie-Scot
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Our room (25) was oddly shaped but big enough, its decor was really strange though. Negative's: its toilet was in a separate room from the bathroom which I didn't like as you had to come out one room and go in another to wash your hands!!! The hairdryer didn't work and there was no shower curtain. There was also very few sockets and none near a mirror (which you couldn't take off the wall - I had to dry my hair in my reflection on the tv screen - not easy!). The majority of staff are unfriendly, but you don't really come into contact with them much. Positives: The hotel was kept spotless and our rooms were made every day with fresh towels. The air con worked great. Breakfast was adequate. The area the hotel is situated in was great, as the hotel was surronded by official buildings, there were guards and police everywhere (but not in your face). We felt very safe to walk around at night. It was about a 5-10 min walk to champs elysees, the nearest metro stop is champs elysees clemenceau with again is about a 5-10 min walk. I really liked staying here (for a short break), we had been to paris once before and our previous hotel doesn't even come close to this one. If you are looking for a basic but clean hotel this is perfect. If you have to arrange transport you can get the Rossybus from Charles de gaulle airport to the Opera where you have to change metro lines twice to get to CE Clemenceau or you can get the airport bus from Charles De Gaulle to the Arc de triomph and then get the no1 line down 3 or 4 stops to clemenceau. A taxi from the hotel to this airport was 50 euros. Had we not been leaving at 8am (rush hour) I would have got the metro to the opera and then the bus to the airport for about 9 euros each. The bus leaves every 15mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Platz
Reviews.Content: Great location, very helpful staff even those speaking broken English. Room was clean and tidy with rather strange wall paper! Breakfast (continental) was â‚¬12 which seems a lot but it did fill you up. Lift was next to useless taking two people or one with a bag (and it was broken on one day) so do not visit if you have mobility problems as this place has five floors! I was very fit after a week! I did however like the place and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: mschanel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysee for 3 nights in Dec, it is in a very safe area, the president lives accross the road! Police are everywhere! The front desk people do speak english but not overly helpful, the rooms were ok - ours was big ( room 10) it was clean but a little worn, forget using the lift - it was so small it was funny - luckily we were on the first floor and only had 1 flight of stairs - you can only fit 1 person at a time - I promise you - think of a phone booth! It was only a 10-15 min walk to the champs elysee, there is a little pub accross the road, nice people but very noisy - there were no good cafes nearby which was annoying! It was very close to designer shopping - 10 mins away ( Chanel, Dior, Prada etc...) which was great.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: frona
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in this beautiful place twice- tha second time requesting the same room we had had on our first trip. The reception staff cound not have been nicer. the rooms are small but in keeping with the parisian feel. perfect location for touring the city, and great for those looking for that something to add to the romance of their trip- it works!- if thats what your after. we will look no further the next time we return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollyjane6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was incredibly quaint and well-decorated. The bathroom was very nice, though definitely European. We really liked staying here. It was a bit pricey, but for Paris, we're told it was a pretty good deal. The location is nice and very quiet, with a good bar across the street! Overall, we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Sions
Reviews.Content: Had to trawl through several pages of Trip Advisor recommendations before finding this hotel. It certailnly deserves to be rated much higher. It's a little gem. Quaint and comfortable room. Excellent receptionist who bent over backwards to please. Superb location. I'd definitely stay there again. Mine was a business trip but I'd highly recommend it for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel - look no further”
Reviews.Author: 53BLOSSOM
Reviews.Content: My finacee and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in January 07 and when we return to Paris we will look no further than this hotel as it will be top of our list. The hotel is ideally situated just one street from the Champs Elysee and near Royal buildings so you always felt safe as there were guards stationed at regular points on the walk to the Champs Elysee. The hotel itself was lovely and had a quaint French/English feel to it. We were very lucky in that our room was large and had our own balcony (we were on the 5th floor). The reception staff were extremely helpful and always friendly. I cannot recommend this lovely hotel enough - even though I would like to keep it as my little secret Paris hideaway!

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, nice place”
Reviews.Author: MikeSkinner1
Reviews.Content: I was looking for medium priced hotel in central paris and was intrigued by the reviews on trip advisor. I booked it without seeing a photo as I thought it sounded right up my "rue". However, whilst the suite was nice, it was not what I had expected from the hotel website. The room was ridiculously dark. Oh, and it said breakfast was included in the prce. It wasn't. It was an extra â‚¬36 for 3 days. Had I known that, I would have eaten out. Having said all of that, it was central, clean, and the staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: shannonignite
Reviews.Content: This place is great. I've stayed in the hotel all three of my trips to Paris. The staff is great. The hotel is close to many attractions. I would get the breakfast every morning... they bring it to your room on a tray. There is nothing like breakfast in bed... coffee, hot chocolate, eggs, yogurt, and don't forget the croissants. The restaurant across the street is great to (Bugsy's). I would eat there just about every other day.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Paris but don't tell anyone, I still want to have rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jeanfrancoisdor-com
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel in Paris but don't tell anyone, I still want to have rooms! This is a perfect location, just off the Champs-Elysees, in front of the Ministry of Defence (so quite safe!) a stroll to the Elysee Palace and Matignon and the Rue du Faubourg St Honore where you will find all my favourite shops... The rue des Saussaies attracts quite a few comments as very near phonetically to sausages! But that is only in English, or is it? All rooms quite different as the building is old, very old but with all 'mod-cons'

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a five day stay in Paris and the city was really, really wonderful. We will definetely return! Hotel de l'Elysee is a cozy hotel located in a really nice neighbourhood where you don't have to feel worried neither day nor night. Due to the Ministry of Internal affairs (or similar) closeby there are a lot of policemen walking the streets. For those interested in fashion, many, many luxurious shops can be found nearby this hotel. We stayed in a superiour twin room on second floor and experienced no "trouble" whatsoever. /Couple visiting Paris for the first time

Reviews.Title: “Very "Parisian"!”
Reviews.Author: mkreese
Reviews.Content: Loved the "shabby French" feel of these rooms. My husband brought me here on my first trip to Paris and we stayed in both of the "attic" rooms during our stay. VERY romantic - one with a long wall of windows and nook for the bed, the second with a sky light with views of the Eiffel Tower. When it started to snow I knew that I was instantly in love with this city. Be warned however, the elevator does not go to the top floors so my husband had to put me and the luggage on the lift (it wouldn't fit both of us and luggage!) and meet us at the top. We then had to carry our bags up another flight to our rooms. If the situation allows, I would recommend booking both rooms which can be joined with a foyer for a wonderful couples vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really liked this little hotel. It's very Parisian and very charming. Most importantly, the neighbourhood was very safe and clean. The staff are friendly and they also spoke English. I am very picky about hotels and cleaniness/ safety. This one worked out very well and I would stay there again. There's also a good little restaurant across the street called Bugsy's.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be reccomended highly enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of travelling and have stayed several times in Paris. This hotel far surpassed my expectations. I went with my girlfriend late in August over the bank holiday. The hotel room was clean and spacious with a pleasant en suite bathroom. THe complaints by other reviewwrs of a noisy road are no big deal beacuse it is quiter at night and who stays in their room on a trip to Paris in the day anyway. I wold recommed maybe doing breakfast. I didt take it (11 euros) but went searching for a little cafe to find anything like an orange juice a nd a croissant. I walked for an hour trying to find somewhere eventually getting a cab back to the hotel! It is situated about 10 minutes from the bottom of the Champs Elysee and probably ten minutes from Rue du Royale and the place de concorde. In short, the hotel is great value for its location, cleanliness, boutiquiness, beautiful decor, colour TVs: book this hotel - its only a ten euro cab ride from gare de nord station!

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: PennypieceReadingUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this is a great little hotel over the final weekend of the Tour de France. It is very centrally located, especially for the Champs Elysee and designer shops. The rooms aren't huge but nicely furnished and very clean. The staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was additional but well worth the 11 Euro surcharge. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was introduced to the Hotel de l'Elysee a few years ago by a lady I know who owns a shop around the corner in the Faubourg St-Honore. Dainty and charming are the words to describe it. The elevator accommodates exactly two people at a time, and they'd better be on intimate terms with each other going in. It's at 12 Rue des Saussaies, right across from the Deuxieme Bureau's old front door of 11 Rue des Saussaies in the Ministry of the Interior complex of buildings. (11 Rue des Saussaies was also Gestapo headquarters in 1940-44.) Just beyond the hotel's front door is Bugsy's, an 'American' style bar and bistro that is run by an Irishman named Dermot, and about as American as RyanAir. But it's a great gathering place for the Anglophone locals in Paris, mostly young Brit banker types. When I first went to this hotel you could get the tiny room at the top for a mere 550 Francs (about $85). Thanks to the decline of the dollar and a rise in prices generally, that tiny room (cinquante-trois, if you must know) now costs me about $120. For this reason I now use a cheaper, two-star, hotel up north of the Gare St-Lazare, where I can stay two or three nights for that much dosh. The only ugly thing about my experiences at the hotel was a series of encounters with a subcontinental night manager named Anwar, who gave excellent massages and was forever trying to seduce me. I couldn't figure out what his game was. But I dropped an understated word or two in the vicinity of the Elysee Palace, and I understand Anwar is now persona non grata in the City of Light.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor. Charming, but small rooms. Located on a quiet street just a couple short blocks from the Champs De Elysee. Rooms were a bit too warm in March/April timeframe. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a 3 star hotel.. I recommend this one.
